required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Afamelanotide in Patients With Xeroderma Pigmentosum (XP)
clinical_study.official_title: A Proof of Concept, Phase IIa, Open Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Subcutaneous Implants of Afamelanotide in Patients With Xeroderma Pigmentosum (XP)

brief_summary.textblock: The CUV156 study will evaluate the safety of afamelanotide in XP-C patients, as well as the drug's ability to assist reparative processes following ultraviolet (UV) provoked DNA damage of the skin. It will assess whether SCENESSEÂ® increases the amount of UV light needed to cause DNA damage of skin cells, as well as the extent of skin repair before and after treatment.

primary_outcome.description: MED is the lowest dose of UV light that causes reddening of the skin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in UV-induced DNA damage and repair capacity.
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of UV photoproducts and DNA repair mechanisms.
The higher the score, the more severe the disease.
The higher the score, the more severe the disease.
The higher the score, the more severe the disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life assessed by a disease specific tool (A)
secondary_outcome.description: Higher scores represent worse health-related quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life assessed by a validated global quality of life tool (B)
secondary_outcome.description: Score calculated in impairment percentages, with higher numbers indicating greater impaired quality of life.

intervention.description: Patients will receive afamelanotide every two weeks for twelve weeks and undergo a follow up visit 6 months later.
